synthesis_method: The electrolyte synthesis process involves weighing lithium sulfide (Li₂S) and phosphoric sulfide (P₂S₅) in a glove box to achieve a molar ratio of 75:25, mixing them in an agate mortar to obtain 1g compositions, followed by mechanical lapping in a planetary ball mill for 40 hours to produce a solid electrolyte material (75Li₂S·25P₂S₅ Glass), and then adding cupric oxide (CuO) as an inhibitor at 30% based on the solid electrolyte material and mixing in an agate mortar to obtain the lithium ion conducting material.
